INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quinidine and risk of overdose (decrease of the renal excretion of the quinidine by alkalinizing of the urine).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the quinidinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage during the alkalinizing treatment and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinidine due to decrease of its metabolism by the cobicistat
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In a post surgical indication: clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the dabigatran to 150 mg/day in one dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin. In addition, disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia and disorders of atrioventricular conduction)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. In the case of an unexpected result, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the quinidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment with quinidine at minimum recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, as well as tinnitis and/or decrease of auditory acuity (cinchonism), due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the quinidine
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quidinine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ombitasvir+paritaprevir combination
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the quinidine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the torsade inducing medication)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and the dose of the torsade inducing medication, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large increase of the hemodynamic effects of the verapamil, with severe hypotension and bradycardia
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with the quinidine and after it is stopped.
